title: Not very user friendly
comment: This app is a study in poor UX design. The blank start screen offers no options, actions or instructions. There's no "open file" action, and the app does not inform other apps to use it to open SVG files. The end result is that you have to really know what you're doing to get this app to work for you. (For instance, I used ES File Explorer to open files in this app.) Once open, SVG files seem to render well enough; the starting zoom level was illogical, though.

title: Great
comment: Does exactly what it says, loads quickly. Two things would make it even better: Multidirectional scrolling (i.e. diagonal); return to file manager when back button pressed (it currently 'jams' the file manager)
Would not open my svg files

title: Views inkscape svg files nicely
comment: The only complaint I have is that it only shows the content that is within the the page borders as defined by inkscape.  Keep all your images inside the page boundaries and you should be fine.  It's a very clean app that worked flawlessly for me on a Galaxy S4.

author_name: Andres Rafael Alcantar De La O
title: Do not open inkscape svg files
comment: moved my inkscape svg files to my nexus 4 and tried to open them with the app but got an "Web page not available". It seems this app just tries to open the svg files with the phone's browser.  No good

title: Can't get it to work
comment: It only opens a pink square everyone I load a file. Not sure what's wrong. ASUS TF700T.

title: Views SVG, but "hijacks" file browser on Galaxy S III
comment: It seems to work fine as an SVG viewer on my Samsung Galaxy S III, but there doesn't appear to be any way to exit it!   Every time I open an SVG file from "My Files" (the default file browser), the SVG file displays just fine, but when I hit "Back", I get all the way back to the Home screen, not the file browser. If I try to use the file browser again, I just get the SVG file I was previously viewing. Hitting the menu key doesn't bring up anything. No amount of double-tapping on tap-and-holding brings up any option or button or icon. So, it effectively supplants the default file browser completely until I go into "Settings -> Application Manager -> SVG viewer" and "Force quit".  It seems to be a fine SVG viewer, but it is rendered unusable by this bug :(

title: Great potential, but needs work
comment: Annoying bug: clips part of <path> on Nexus 7 and 10 tablets. Extent of clip varies w/ zoom level.  Otherwise excellent, fills a long-standing gap in Android functionality.

title: great
comment: works, i dont know much about svg format, but app allowd you to select text in svg files.

title: Opens straight from Dropbox
comment: Fantastic! Works well with Nexus 7 and opens files straight from Dropbox. Occasionally squashes text together but handles actual vectors well.
